DisplayString.Name: Inside Technologies - QNAP Storage
DisplayString.Description: Custom Management Pack for QNAP Storage Devices created by Silvio Di Benedetto. For feedback and support visit Inside Technologies web site.

DisplayString.Name: CPU Usage
DisplayString.Description: QNAP Devices Processor Usage Performance View

DisplayString.Name: CPU Temperature
DisplayString.Description: QNAP Devices Processor Temperature Performance View

DisplayString.Name: Memory Free
DisplayString.Description: QNAP Devices Free Memory Performance View

DisplayString.Name: QNAP Storage Discovery Data Source Module
DisplayString.Description: Discovers a particular model of network device by retrieving its Object Id.

DisplayString.Name: QNAP Memory Usage
DisplayString.Description: Memory utilization for device {0} is under the threshold. Memory available is {1} MB

DisplayString.Name: QNAP Processor Utilization
DisplayString.Description: Processor utilization for device {0} is over the threshold. Processor utilization is {1} %

DisplayString.Name: QNAP CPU Temperature
DisplayString.Description: Processor temperature for device {0} is over the threshold. Temperature is {1} degrees

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This Management Pack monitors QNAP Storage.
Devices have to be discovered first through the built-in SCOM 2012 R2 Network Monitoring.
To enable the QNAP device monitoring the device must be discovered using the standard Operations Manager SNMP Discovery process.
Performance data (CPU, Memory and Network) is collected for QNAP Devices.
The Management Pack discovers QNAP and monitors their state.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: If the alert is in Health state means that the CPU Usage of QNAP is under 80%.
If the alert is in Critical state means that the CPU Usage of QNAP is over 80%. Maybe there are some process that using the CPU.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This Management Pack monitors QNAP Storage.
Devices have to be discovered first through the built-in SCOM 2012 R2 Network Monitoring.
To enable the QNAP device monitoring the device must be discovered using the standard Operations Manager SNMP Discovery process.
Performance data (CPU, Memory and Network) is collected for QNAP Devices.
The Management Pack discovers QNAP and monitors their state.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: If the alert is in Health state means that the CPU Temperature of QNAP is under 50 degrees.
If the alert is in Critical state means that the CPU Temperature of QNAP is equal or over 50 degrees. Check the room temperature and if the fun works.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This Management Pack monitors QNAP Storage.
Devices have to be discovered first through the built-in SCOM 2012 R2 Network Monitoring.
To enable the QNAP device monitoring the device must be discovered using the standard Operations Manager SNMP Discovery process.
Performance data (CPU, Memory and Network) is collected for QNAP Devices.
The Management Pack discovers QNAP and monitors their state.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: If the alert is in Health state means that the Memory Usage of QNAP is equal or over 400MB.
If the alert is in Critical state means that the Memory Usage of QNAP is less 400MB.
